channel.title: TCP/IP on Ian Ames - I help multidisciplinary teams deliver services in a user centred way.
channel.description: Recent content in TCP/IP on Ian Ames - I help multidisciplinary teams deliver services in a user centred way.

item.title: TCP/IP Protocol Suite
item.description: TCP/IP is a set of protocols that form the backbone of the internet. As I described in the OSI model post, TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of a stream of bytes between applications running on hosts. IP (Internet Protocol) is the protocol for shifting packets around between hosts in the network layer. The TCP/IP suite, however, contains a whole bunch of protocols beyond these two. (Fun fact: If to devices are communicating in a network with TCP/IP they are called network hosts. If they are using anything else they are called network nodes.)
